newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing debt market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing debt market report.

text.p: Dutch bonds closed mixed on Thursday, as the short maturities were slightly pressured by a 0.20 percent hike in the special advances rate and longer paper was buoyed by increased demand in a thin market.
Dealers said many players had expected the rate hike, adding it had already been discounted in short bond prices and money market rates since the beginning of the week.
"Short bonds will be stable if there's a rate hike, they will move if there is no hike," one dealer said before the Dutch central bank announced its decision.
The short benchmark remained stable, losing 0.02 points.
"This is nothing more than a technical adjustment, following the continued weakening of the guilder versus the mark," an analyst said.
He added market players had confidence in the market's long term performance, which had pushed prices of longer-dated paper up.
Buying on dips was seen giving good support, today as well as in the near future.
Dealers said they expected bonds to move in a tight range for a while as the market had to stabilise after the rally of recent weeks.
